item.title: How do I add wilderness coords?
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

yours isnt different … serach nonwild should see somtin like this

public boolean nonWild() {
if((absY >= 2752 && absY <= 3520 && absX <= 3838 && absX >= 2112)||(absX >= 3392 && absX <= 3409 && absY >= 9728 && absY <= 9763) || heightLevel == 1)
return true;
else
return false;
}

item.title: How do I add wilderness coords?
item.dc:creator: @xdarklight.x xdarklight.x
item.description:
@xdarklight.x wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:3, topic:155519”]So if my coords are

top right
x3184
y3690

bottom left
x3146
y3656

Then what would my code look like?[/quote]

Use this base

(absX >=bottom left && absX <=top right && absY >=bottom left && absY <=top right )

i had a pix for it also but i cant find it

item.title: How do I add wilderness coords?
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

public boolean inwildy = false; //wilderness Coords public boolean inwildy2 = false; public void checkwildy() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672)) { inwildy = false; } else { inwildy = true; } } public void checkwildy2() { if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514)) { inwildy2 = false; } else { inwildy2 = true; } }

This is how MY source’s wilderness is set up… any one know how to add the coords in? Like the order of the coords?

Read full topic
